alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Henry; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, southeastern Delaware and northeastern Henry Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of New Castle, or 12 miles southeast of Muncie, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Randolph, southeastern Delaware and northeastern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Summit Lake State Park, Blountsville, Mooreland, Losantville, Modoc and Mount Summit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central Indiana.
